items.title: Beyond hardening: Rethinking storm resilience on the power grid
items.summary: Utilities need more than stronger poles and wires to define storm response in a way that is connected to a larger rethinking of resilience.

items.title: Europe risks blackouts without improved grid interconnection says Ember
items.summary: Limited electricity import options across over half of the European continent are increasing blackout risks, says Ember in a research report.

items.title: North American energy professionals report slower hiring: AEE survey
items.summary: North Americans also displayed more skepticism toward their infrastructure, with 83% saying their local grid could not handle rapid electrification within the next 10 years.

items.title: Utilities Unwired: How to balance and stabilize load, with Cindy Klingler from Scott Manufacturing Solutions, Inc.

items.title: Electric Boats Drive New England Aquaculture
items.summary: This article was originally published by Canary Media . At a dock along the banks of the Cousins River, Chad Strater loaded up his small aluminum workboat with power tools and a winch.
